intro: Ampliglossum paranapiacabense, commonly known as the Paranapiacá balm, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its striking red and yellow inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, showy flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
